content.question:
HENDERSON, NEVADA, POPULATION AND HOUSING GROWTH, 2000–2010

Total population in 2000
 175,381

Total population in 2010
 257,729

Population change
 82,348

Percent change
 47.0%

Number of housing units in 2000
 71,149

Number of housing units in 2010
 113,586

Housing-unit change
 42,437

Percent change
 59.6%

The photograph above shows high-density residential housing built in the early 2000s in Henderson, Nevada, a suburb of Las Vegas, developed to accommodate large increases in population in the area. Which of the following best explains the growth in population and housing shown in the image and the census data?

choices.label: The growth brought on by resource extraction and industrialization
The impacts of deindustrialization in other Sun Belt–region cities
A period of immigration from southern Europe and eastern Europe
A cycle of rapid economic development and real estate investment
A phase of water-resource and hydroelectric-power development

content.answer: A cycle of rapid economic development and real estate investment

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Compare patterns and trends in maps and in quantitative and geospatial data to draw conclusions.
